title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: article describes process import output Beaufort Assessment Model (BAM) create Base Case multi-species multi-fleet operating models (OMs) used openMSE framework.

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: latest development versions MSEtool bamExtras need installed GitHub:

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: number simulations (nsim) number projection years (proyears) need specified OM. setting global variables OM create number stochastic simulations projection years: OM also requires specification Observation Model. Observation Model used simulate fishery data used management procedures projection phase closed-loop simulation testing. using Perfect_Info fishery data currently used within management options (static management options currently explored). can changed later dynamic management options respond observed fishery data added analysis.
code: nsim <- 100 # number of simulations proyears <- 25 # number of projection years Obs_Model <- MSEtool::Perfect_Info

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: current analysis focused three stocks: red snapper Lutjanus campechanus, gag grouper Mycteroperca microlepis, black seabass Centropristis striata. MSE framework flexible, stocks can added analysis following process used . demonstrate creating OMs three case study stocks. recent BAM assessments used: Red snapper: SEDAR 73 Gag grouper: SEDAR 71 Black seabass: SEDAR 76

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: BAM assessments imported bamExtras package:
code: rdat_RS <- bamExtras::rdat_RedSnapper |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat() rdat_GG <- bamExtras::rdat_GagGrouper |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat() rdat_BS <- bamExtras::rdat_BlackSeaBass |> bamExtras::standardize_rdat()

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: BAM2MOM function used create openMSE operating model objects: OMs now used within openMSE framework. However, wish combine OMs single multi-stock OM (model individually assumption managed together), need create common fleet structure OMs.
code: OM_RS <- BAM2MOM(rdat_RS, stock_name='Red Snapper',                  Obs=Obs_Model,                  nsim=nsim, proyears=proyears) OM_GG <- BAM2MOM(rdat_GG, stock_name='Gag Grouper',                  Obs=Obs_Model,                  nsim=nsim, proyears=proyears) OM_BS <- BAM2MOM(rdat_BS, stock_name='Black Sea Bass',                  Obs=Obs_Model,                  nsim=nsim, proyears=proyears)   rdat = rdat_RS

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: create data frame names fleets within OM: order combine single stock OMs together, OM must fleet structure stocks OM, even fleets actively fishing particular stock. stocks fleets common (e.g., Commercial hook line (cHL)) unique fleets (e.g., Gag Grouper Commercial dive (cDV)). landings discards also modeled separate fleets BAM models (indicated “.D”). black seabass stock two commercial fleets (cHL cPT), discards reported two fleets combined (cGN.D). deal , cHL cPT landing fleets first combined together, discards added combined fleet. create data frame Code, Name, Mapping, Type fleet: Code name fleets within OM objects. Name name associating Code. Mapping variable describes fleets combined together. Type indicates fleet OM represents Landings Discards. Landing Discard components fleet combined single fleet selectivity retention curve. makes easier model changes management changes season lengths, discard mortality, size-based retention selectivity regulations. end result fleet structure four fleets stock: Commercial Line Recreational Headboat General Recreational Commercial Dive
code: fleet_names_df <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper', Fleets=names(OM_RS@Fleets[[1]])),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper', Fleets=names(OM_GG@Fleets[[1]])),   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass', Fleets=names(OM_BS@Fleets[[1]])) ) fleet_df <- data.frame(Code=unique(fleet_names_df$Fleets))  fleet_df$Name <- c('Commercial Line',                    'Recreational Headboat',                    'General Recreational',                    'Commercial Line - Discard',                    'Recreational Headboat - Discard',                    'General Recreational - Discard',                    'Commercial Dive',                    'Commercial Pot',                    'Commercial General - Discard')  fleet_df$Mapping <- c(1,2,3,1,2,3,4,1,1) fleet_df$Type <- 'Landing' fleet_df$Type[grepl('\\.D', fleet_df$Code)] <- 'Discard' fleet_df #>    Code                            Name Mapping    Type #> 1   cHL                 Commercial Line       1 Landing #> 2   rHB           Recreational Headboat       2 Landing #> 3   rGN            General Recreational       3 Landing #> 4 cHL.D       Commercial Line - Discard       1 Discard #> 5 rHB.D Recreational Headboat - Discard       2 Discard #> 6 rGN.D  General Recreational - Discard       3 Discard #> 7   cDV                 Commercial Dive       4 Landing #> 8   cPT                  Commercial Pot       1 Landing #> 9 cGN.D    Commercial General - Discard       1 Discard

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: discard mortality needs added OMs historical effort can adjusted account fish caught released alive, discard mortality can modified projections. discard mortality red dnapper reported Table 6 SEDAR 73. TheYear variable indicates first year discard mortality changes: discard mortality Gag Grouper reported SEDAR 71, fixed discard mortality 0.4 commerical fleet, 0.25 recreational fleets years: discard mortality Black Seabass reported Section 2.2.1 SEDAR 76. average discard mortality calculated combined commercial line pot fleets: stock-specific discard mortality dataframes combined together:
code: discard_mortality_RS <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='cHL',              Year=c(1900, 2007, 2017),              Prob_Dead=c(0.48, 0.38, 0.36)),   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='rHB',              Year=c(1900, 2011, 2018),              Prob_Dead=c(0.37, 0.26, 0.25)),   data.frame(Stock='Red Snapper',              Code='rGN',              Year=c(1900, 2011, 2018),              Prob_Dead=c(0.37, 0.28, 0.26)) ) discard_mortality_GG <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='cHL',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.4),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='rHB',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.25),   data.frame(Stock='Gag Grouper',              Code='rGN',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.25) ) discard_mortality_BS <- dplyr::bind_rows(   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='cHL',              Year=c(1900, 2007),              Prob_Dead=c(mean(0.14,0.19), mean(0.14, 0.068))   ),   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='rHB',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.152),   data.frame(Stock='Black Sea Bass',              Code='rGN',              Year=1900,              Prob_Dead=0.137) ) discard_mortality <- dplyr::bind_rows(discard_mortality_RS,                                       discard_mortality_GG,                                       discard_mortality_BS)

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: Next, Aggregate_Fleets function used aggregate fleets together according mapping defined fleet_df discard mortality added discard_mortality. Aggregate_Fleets function five things: Combine landing fleets mapped together fleet_df (applies Black Seabass) Add discard mortality fleet Combine discard fleets landing fleets produce single fleet selectivity retention curves Add dummy fleets (F=0 years) OMs missing fleets Order fleets OMs
code: OM_RS <- Aggregate_Fleets(OM_RS, fleet_df, discard_mortality) OM_GG <- Aggregate_Fleets(OM_GG, fleet_df, discard_mortality) OM_BS <- Aggregate_Fleets(OM_BS, fleet_df, discard_mortality)

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: spatial structure MSE defined 6 areas, including 3 geographic regions Nearshore (<100ft) Offshore (>100ft) component region (solid dashed black lines respectively Figure 6.1). Figure 6.1: Definition spatial areas used MSE.
code: require(marmap)  bathy <- marmap::getNOAA.bathy(-83, -71.37133, 23.8, 36.55028)  numbers <- data.frame(Number=1:6,                       x=c(-79.5, -77.7, -81, -80.3, -82, -80.3),                       y=c(33, 33, 30, 30, 25, 25))  map <- ggplot()+   geom_raster(data=bathy, aes(x=x, y=y,fill=z)) +   coord_sf() +   marmap::scale_fill_etopo() +   guides(fill='none') +   ggnewscale::new_scale_fill() +   geom_polygon(data =  Spatial_Area_Definition(),                aes(x = X, y = Y, group=Region, fill=Region), alpha=0.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values= c('#7fc97f', '#beaed4', '#fdc086')) +   geom_contour(data=bathy, aes(x=x, y=y, z=z), breaks=c(-30),                colour="black",linewidth=0.2) +   geom_contour(data=bathy, aes(x=x, y=y, z=z), breaks=c(-300),                colour="black",linewidth=0.2, linetype=2) +   geom_text(data=numbers, aes(x=x, y=y, label=Number), size=5) +   scale_x_continuous(expand=c(0,0)) +   scale_y_continuous(expand=c(0,0)) +   labs(x='Longitude', y='Latitude') +   theme(plot.margin=grid::unit(c(0,0,0,0), "mm"))  map

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: relative abundance three stocks specified using output recent study estimated spatiotemporal dynamics reef fish southeastern United States (Cao et al., 2024; K. Shertzer personal communication, May 2024).
code: Rel_Abun_Area_RS <- data.frame(   Area=1:6,   Region=c(rep('North and South Carolina',2),            rep('Georgia - Cape Canaveral',2),            rep('Cape Canaveral - Florida',2)),   Depth=c('Nearshore', 'Offshore'),   Stock='Red Snapper',   Proportion=c(0.03,0.01, 0.7, 0.19, 0.03, 0.04) )  Rel_Abun_Area_GG <- data.frame(   Area=1:6,   Region=c(rep('North and South Carolina',2),            rep('Georgia - Cape Canaveral',2),            rep('Cape Canaveral - Florida',2)),   Depth=c('Nearshore', 'Offshore'),   Stock='Gag Grouper',   Proportion=c(0.34, 0.21, 0.21, 0.18, 0.03, 0.03) )  Rel_Abun_Area_BS <- data.frame(   Area=1:6,   Region=c(rep('North and South Carolina',2),            rep('Georgia - Cape Canaveral',2),            rep('Cape Canaveral - Florida',2)),   Depth=c('Nearshore', 'Offshore'),   Stock='Black Seabass',   Proportion=c(0.14, 0.02, 0.72, 0.06, 0.04, 0.02) )

what: Add Stock Spatial Structure to OMs
title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: age-specific relative distribution stock across depth zones modeled assuming 100%, 95%, 80% age-0, -1, -2 fish respectively occurred nearshore region. depth distribution age-3+ fish, well relative spatial distribution fishing fleets, calculated optimizing age-3+ stock fleet-specific effort spatial distributions relative distribution biomass across six areas terminal year operating models closely matched reported relative distribution spatiotemporal model (see ).
code: OM_RS <- Add_Spatial_to_OM(OM_RS, Rel_Abun_Area_RS)  OM_GG <- Add_Spatial_to_OM(OM_GG, Rel_Abun_Area_GG)  OM_BS <- Add_Spatial_to_OM(OM_BS, Rel_Abun_Area_BS)

what: Generate Correlated Recruitment Deviations for Projections
title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: multivariate normal distribution (truncated 2 standard deviations) used estimate variance auto-correlation estimated recruitment deviations, together correlation recruitment deviations three stocks. distribution used generate recruitment deviations projection period, maintaining statistic properties historical recruitment deviations estimated stock assessments (Figure 7.1). Figure 7.1: Scatterplots marginal distributions showing correlated recruitment deviations used projections.
code: OMList <- Generate_Correlated_Rec_Devs(list(OM_RS, OM_GG, OM_BS), truncsd=2)  Plot_Correlated_Rec_Devs(OMList)  OM_RS <- OMList[[1]] OM_GG <- OMList[[2]] OM_BS <- OMList[[3]]

title: Building Base Case Operating Models
text: Three single-stock, multi-fleet operating models now created. next thing confirm fishery dynamics generated operating model sufficiently close estimated BAM output. Simulate function used simulate historical fishery dynamics described OM, Compare_Biomass function creates plot compare biomass OM BAM output. plots show biomass generated OMs closely matches biomass reported stock assessments. minor differences two caused spatial structure imposed onto output non-spatial stock assessment.
code: Hist_RS <- Simulate(OM_RS, silent = TRUE, nsim=2) Compare_Biomass(Hist_RS, rdat_RS) Hist_GG <- Simulate(OM_GG, silent = TRUE, nsim=2) Compare_Biomass(Hist_GG, rdat_GG) Hist_BS <- Simulate(OM_BS, silent = TRUE, nsim=2) Compare_Biomass(Hist_BS, rdat_BS)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Adrian Hordyk. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hordyk (2024). SAMSE: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation. R package version 0.0.0.9005, https://safmc-mse.bluematterscience.com.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SAMSE: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation},   author = {Adrian Hordyk},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9005},   url = {https://safmc-mse.bluematterscience.com}, }

title: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation
text: South Atlantic Fishery Management Council (SAFMC) working Blue Matter Science Ltd. conduct Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE) describe expected outcomes different management approaches Snapper-Grouper Fishery. SAMSE R package includes code run MSE analysis. SAMSE builds age-structured, spatial multispecies, operating models (OMs) output Beaufort Assessment Models (BAM). OMs projected forwarded different management scenarios performance statistics used compare performance different management approaches. SAMSE uses openMSE platform build OMs conduct closed-loop simulation testing. Documentation building OMs, specifying management methods, running closed-loop simualation testing available Articles menu top navigation bar.

title: South Atlantic Management Strategy Evaluation
text: can install SAMSE GitHub :

title: Management Procedures — MPs
code: Create_Rec_List(DataList)  Get_Year_Info(DataList)  SQ(x, DataList, ...)  Adjust_Effort(RecList, Effort_Mod = 0, ...)  SQ_FR(x, DataList, First_Management_Year = 2025, ...)  SQ_MLL(x, DataList, First_Management_Year = 2025, ...)  SQ_NS(x, DataList, First_Management_Year = 2025, ...)  SQ_OS(x, DataList, First_Management_Year = 2025, ...)  SQ_FR_MLL(x, DataList, First_Management_Year = 2025, ...)  SQ_FR_MLL_NS(x, DataList, ...)  SQ_FR_MLL_OS(x, DataList, ...)

title: Management Procedures — MPs
text: DataList nested list Data objects x Simulation number ... Additional arguments RecList list Rec objects returned MMP Effort_Mod Effort modifier. Effort adjusted Effort_Rec_Fleet <- Effort_Rec_Fleet * (1-Effort_Mod) First_Management_Year Year management procedures first implemented

title: Management Procedures — MPs
text: Create_Rec_List(): Generate list Rec objects MMP Get_Year_Info(): Return information current year DataList SQ(): Status Quo. Fishing effort fleet fixed projection years geometric mean three last historical years Adjust_Effort(): Adjust fishing effort General Recreational Fleet SQ_FR(): Status Quo Full Retention. Modify retention curve asymptote 1 SQ_MLL(): Status Quo stock specific size limit. SQ_NS(): Status Quo offshore areas closed fishing SQ_OS(): Status Quo nearshore areas closed fishing SQ_FR_MLL(): Status Quo full retention minimum size limit SQ_FR_MLL_NS(): Status Quo full retention, minimum size limit, offshore closed SQ_FR_MLL_OS(): Status Quo full retention, minimum size limit, nearshore closed
